findings.title: Possible Reentrancy Issues
findings.description: A crafty attacker may find a way to trigger a reentrancy attack in the MintingFactoryV2 contract using trustworthy contracts like accessControls, koda, marketplace, and royaltiesRegistry.

findings.title: Arithmetic errors
findings.description: Potential arithmetic errors in commissions calculations, including multiplication and division operations that may cause precision loss or overflow.

findings.title: Outdated version of Solidity compiler
findings.description: The solidity version declared in the audited contracts is 0.8.4, which is outdated. The latest version released at the time of this audit is 0.8.13.

findings.title: Missing or misused function qualifiers
findings.description: The audit report mentions this finding but does not provide specific details.

findings.title: Needlessly complex code and contract interactions
findings.description: The audit report highlights the presence of needlessly complex code and contract interactions, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Poor or nonexistent error handling
findings.description: The audit report highlights the issue of poor or nonexistent error handling in the smart contract.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of the input parameters
Centralization and Upgrades
findings.description: The admin role has extensive control over the contract, including upgrading, transferring funds, and updating various parameters, which can lead to centralization issues.
